channel.title: Help client.java issue

item.title: Help client.java issue
item.dc:creator: @sjoukjeowns sjoukjeowns
item.description:
@sjoukjeowns wrote:

ok, first u started probably your server up once find a code they use like ::pure
then search in client.java (ctrl+f) search for pure
then u find a code right under that add this

if (command.equals(name)) && playerRights > 2) {
teleportToX = coordinatex;
teleportToY = coordinatey;
}

name=the name of the command if u put it as adminzone it will be ::adminzone in your server playerrights 2 is for admins 1 is for everyone
x coordinate
y coordinate

probably in your server there is something like ::mypos or at the run tab u see where you are some sources have some coordinates in a text file

put them in
don’t forget the }

now click compile and your done!!

if i were you i should download the voule command generator easy for a 317!!

Read full topic

item.title: Help client.java issue
item.dc:creator: @lord_dharok lord dharok
item.description:
@lord_dharok wrote:

Exactly what i noob iii just said. Open client.java
hit ctrl+f and type in “home” (without quotation marks) or “teleto” or “Kq” or something like that.

Copy the entire thing the

if (command.equals(home)) { //
teleportToX = coordinate;
teleportToY = coordinate;
}

and paste it right under there. Now edit the pasted one to your liking. So if I wanted a command to go to admin zone:

if (command.equals(adminzone)) && playerRights > 2) {
teleportToX = coordinatex;
teleportToY = coordinatey;
}
And I would rep up i noob iii but I cant lol. Well Ive spoonfed enough.

ok ive used this in client.java

if (command.equals(adminzone)) && playerRights > 2) {
teleportToX = coordinatex;
teleportToY = coordinatey;

but it is not working when i put in the coordinates but then again i dk where to put it in client .java please help me and tell me where to put it

Read full topic
